description: From Latin dyspnoea, from δύσπνοια (dúspnoia, “difficult breathing”), compound of δυσ- (dus-, “difficult, bad, unfortunate”) and πνοή (pnoḗ, “breeze”). By surface analysis, dys- +‎ -pnea.

entries.meaning: (pathology, North American spelling) Difficult or labored respiration; shortness of breath.
